timeline.bodyText: signalId name is quite confusing IMO, what about signalNamePath or sanitizedSignalName... just some suggestions
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText: suggestion to extract the signalName.replaceAll("\\s", "_")) to a class/method, this logic could be used to sanitize and generate the path for endpoints when needed, not only in this place, wdyt?
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText: the same logic used to sanitize used here...
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText:
isn't better to interpolate the method name signal based on the $taskname$? if you check 
  
    
      kogito-runtimes/kogito-codegen/src/main/java/org/kie/kogito/codegen/process/AbstractResourceGenerator.java
    
    
         Line 151
      in
      e5994ce
    
    
    
    

        
          
           String methodName = "signal_" + index.getAndIncrement(); 
        
    
  

 when the other methods for signals where generated it was used a "counter" but basically to avoid name conflicts probably.
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: For tasks the nodeId is being used, not the taskName. In order to avoid conflicts between userTask signals and other signals I will reuse the existing index.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: minor, but why not use camelCase for tasknodename
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: following the same naming pattern. I'll then change it for taskName as well
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText:
so If I understood correctly method is always added by the template and it is being removed here in case of ad-hoc, right?
Where the method name is generated based on the "signal_" + userTask.getId() ? on the template the method is just called signal, I missed this point
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: perhaps the method should not be added in the first place?
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I think it's better to add it by default and remove it if the node is not adHoc. That way you have an easier understanding of how the method would look like. This is also how it is done in other parts of the process template.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.author: cristianonicolai

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    given()
          
          
            
                            .contentType(ContentType.JSON)
          
          
            
                            .when()
          
          
            
                            .body(params)
          
          
            
                            .post("/AdHocProcess")
          
          
            
                            .then()
          
          
            
                            .statusCode(200)
          
          
            
                            .body("id", not(emptyOrNullString()))
          
          
            
                            .body("var1", equalTo("Hello first! Script"))
          
          
            
                            .body("var2", equalTo("second Script 2"));
          
          
            
                    given()
          
          
            
                            .contentType(ContentType.JSON)
          
          
            
                    .when()
          
          
            
                            .body(params)
          
          
            
                            .post("/AdHocProcess")
          
          
            
                    .then()
          
          
            
                            .statusCode(200)
          
          
            
                            .body("id", not(emptyOrNullString()))
          
          
            
                            .body("var1", equalTo("Hello first! Script"))
          
          
            
                            .body("var2", equalTo("second Script 2"));
timeline.author: cristianonicolai
cristianonicolai

timeline.bodyText:
I still didn't get where is the place the method name was set with "signal_" + index.getAndIncrement(), because to filter here, to be removed from the template, you should have set this before, right? I didn't found where it is being set.
By the way is there a specific test to check if the method was removed from the generated code?
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText:
This filter was wrong and that's why it failed during the tests. The name of the task methods are now generated using the taskPath
I am updating the integration tests for this too.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: So in the end this Map can be put back inside the if statement, right? As dynamicParams is not used outside of the if.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: Maybe an additional formatting here would help when reading.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Formatting is still a little bit of.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: Is there any reason to introduce a new parameter? By looking at the AbstractResourceGenerator, signalPath and signalName are replaced with the same signalName value. So having here the same parameter might be less misleading.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: SignalPath is the sanitized name e.g. Service_Task whereas signalName is the name of the event that will match the node name e.g. Service Task
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText:
Just a question from the performance point of view. Now I think in Business Central on 7.x, when we trigger a fragment we just send a signal and don't check if it has been triggered I think. We just return as soon as the signal has been sent successfully. This additional check may be not needed/wanted by some users maybe.
I am not saying it's bad, maybe we should just think also about the quicker option.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
The type of userTasks that can receive a signal are the ones that are adHocFragments meaning that are not activated by the previous node or automatically.
I consider these kind of tasks are most likely to be triggered by web applications that might like to use the created task so actually it will save the external service/webapp from requesting all the tasks and filter out the one that was just created.
An example can be an "Add review" button that creates the task for a buyer to add a review but the application transparently renders the form with the link returned in the previous request.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: OK, I see now. I didn't notice that you actually use the found task.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText: Here the additional check is missing. Is it OK?
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Check added to be in sync with RestResourceUserTaskTemplate.java.
replies.author: MarianMacik

timeline.bodyText:
I think the call to pi.variables() should be wrapped in getModel To filter out inputs, internals etc
Same as done here https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-runtimes/pull/596/files#diff-6350da7d2030cb169a6592ea0de9c8bdR98
timeline.author: mswiderski

timeline.bodyText: Same here about wrapping in getModel
timeline.author: mswiderski

timeline.bodyText: And one more wrap with getModel
timeline.author: mswiderski
